title: The World Wide Recipe: A Community-Centred Framework for Fine-Grained Data Collection and Regional Bias Operationalisation
description: A framework for culturally aware, community-centred data collection and the World Wide Dishes evaluation dataset comprising 765 unique dishes across 106 countries in 131 local languages. We analyse how T2I models underperform across accuracy, representation, and cultural sensitivity dimensions. Models produce inaccurate and culturally misrepresentative outputs even for well-resourced regions such as the US, with worse performance for African countries. Over 50% of community-sourced dishes didn't exist in web-scraped datasets, proving the limits of automated scraping.

title: VisoGender: A Dataset for Benchmarking Gender Bias in Image-Text Pronoun Resolution
description: A dataset for benchmarking gender bias in vision-language models, focusing on occupation-related biases within binary gender presentation. Inspired by Winogender schemas, VisoGender evaluates resolution bias (pronoun resolution accuracy differences) and retrieval bias (gender presentation ratios in search results). Benchmarking state-of-the-art models reveals bias in resolving binary gender in complex scenes, with captioning models generally less biased than Vision-Language Encoders.

title: A Prompt Array Keeps the Bias Away: Debiasing Vision-Language Models with Adversarial Learning
description: Vision-language models encode societal biases, but measuring and mitigating these harms is challenging due to lacking robustness and feature degradation. We apply ranking metrics for image-text representations and show that learned embeddings prepended to text queries—jointly trained with adversarial debiasing and contrastive loss—reduce various bias measures with minimal degradation to image-text representation.

title: SMRS: Advocating a Unified Reporting Standard for Surrogate Models
description: Surrogate models approximate expensive simulations across fields from climate prediction to drug discovery, but are developed differently across disciplines, making them impossible to reproduce or compare. We introduce the Surrogate Model Reporting Specification (SMRS), a lightweight checklist capturing key design choices: data collection, model type, uncertainty handling, and performance evaluation. SMRS provides a structured reporting standard to make surrogate modeling more transparent, comparable, and trustworthy across scientific fields.

title: Finite Element Modelling for Biophysical Models of Cortical Stimulation: A Computational Framework
description: Methods for FEM modeling of peripheral and central nervous systems for testing cortical stimulation hypotheses and electrode designs before in vitro/in vivo experiments. We evaluate the impact of differentiation errors on calculating the Activating Function and predicting action potentials in Hodgkin-Huxley axon models. Poor spatial discretisation generates double-derivative noise, with coarser meshes requiring higher activation thresholds (57.5 mA vs 55 mA). Our findings support using the finest spatial discretizations possible within computational constraints and coupling extracellular fields to H-H-based axons.

title: The Human Labour of Data Work: Understanding the Challenges of Data Collection in the Global South
description: Guidance for building and maintaining infrastructure for participatory AI through reflections on World Wide Dishes (WWD), a bottom-up, community-led dataset of culinary dishes and cultural customs. WWD demonstrates participatory dataset creation where community members guide research design and contribute to crowdsourcing, incorporating localized expertise to address limitations of web-scraped Internet datasets acknowledged in Participatory AI discourse.
